dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, you know, we've been hearing a lot about cyberattacks, right? But Microsoft just dropped a pretty significant warning about Russian hackers targeting, uh, American democracy again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, you know, we've been hearing a lot about cyberattacks, right? But Microsoft just dropped a pretty significant warning about Russian hackers targeting, uh, American democracy again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Microsoft: Russian Hackers Are Targeting The Midterms Russian hackers are back targeting American democracy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's, like, definitely ramping up for the midterms. What's interesting this time, though, is they're not *just* going after elected officials, but also think tanks, you know? Like the International Republican Institute and the Hudson Institute.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's, like, definitely ramping up for the midterms. What's interesting this time, though, is they're not just going after elected officials, but also think tanks, you know? Like the International Republican Institute and the Hudson Institute.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The two targets appeared to be two think tanks: the International Republican Institute and the Hudson Institute.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, right. And these aren't just random groups, either. I mean, the IRI, uh, has Senator John McCain on its board, for example. So, pretty high-profile stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, right. And these aren't just random groups, either. I mean, the I R I, uh, has Senator John McCain on its board, for example. So, pretty high-profile stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Senator John McCain sits on the IRI board, as does former White House national security advisor General H.R. McMaster, while the Hudson Institute has a strong focus on foreign policy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the Hudson Institute, they're really focused on finance, so, like, that's a whole other angle. Microsoft's saying these attacks are, uh, posing security threats to a broadening array of groups.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the Hudson Institute, they're really focused on finance, so, like, that's a whole other angle. Microsoft's saying these attacks are, uh, posing security threats to a broadening array of groups.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: while the Hudson Institute has a strong focus on foreign policy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the *method* they're using, it sounds familiar, doesn't it? Like, creating fake websites that look totally legitimate to trick people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the method they're using, it sounds familiar, doesn't it? Like, creating fake websites that look totally legitimate to trick people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fake websites designed to mimic the organizations real sites, ostensibly in anticipation of a future cyberattack, were taken down by Microsoft.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: —Yeah, it's like what happened with John Podesta back in 2016. Just, uh, spoofed login pages.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's like what happened with John Podesta back in twenty sixteen. Just, uh, spoofed login pages.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For instance, in attacks on the Hillary Clinton campaign, the hackers set up fake Google login pages for the candidates staff. John Podesta, Clintons campaign manager, was one of those who fell for the ruse, with catastrophic consequences.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Microsoft actually got orders to shut down, like, six of these fake sites. They're calling the group Fancy Bear, or Strontium.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Microsoft actually got orders to shut down, like, six of these fake sites. They're calling the group Fancy Bear, or Strontium.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Microsoft obtained orders to shut down a total of six websites created by the Fancy Bear group (which Microsoft calls Strontium).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Strontium? Interesting. So they're, um, basically trying to steal passwords for services like SharePoint and Office 365, by the sounds of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Strontium? Interesting. So they're, um, basically trying to steal passwords for services like SharePoint and Office three hundred sixty five, by the sounds of it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The references to Sharepoint, email and Microsoft productivity tools indicated the hackers wanted to steal target passwords for those services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's the goal, yeah. They want to compromise those accounts. And it's not just, like, *new* activity; Microsoft said they've done similar domain seizures, uh, 12 times in the last two years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the goal, yeah. They want to compromise those accounts. And it's not just, like, new activity; Microsoft said they've done similar domain seizures, uh, twelve times in the last two years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Smith said the Redmond giant had carried out similar domain seizures 12 times in two years to shut down 84 fake websites associated with Fancy Bear.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So this has been ongoing. And they're really seeing a pattern similar to what we saw before the 2016 US election and even the 2017 French election.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So this has been ongoing. And they're really seeing a pattern similar to what we saw before the twenty sixteen U S election and even the twenty seventeen French election.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taken together, this pattern mirrors the type of activity we saw prior to the 2016 election in the United States and the 2017 election in France.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And it’s not just think tanks. There were reports of, um, three members of Congress being targeted recently too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And it's not just think tanks. There were reports of, um, three members of Congress being targeted recently too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In July, Microsoft warned that domains had been set up in apparent hacking attempts on three members of Congress.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Senator Claire McCaskill, a Democrat from Missouri, actually confirmed she was a target. Thankfully, it sounds like those attempts weren't successful.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Senator Claire McCaskill, a Democrat from Missouri, actually confirmed she was a target. Thankfully, it sounds like those attempts weren't successful.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Not long after, Senator Claire McCaskill, a Democrat in Missouri, confirmed she'd been a target of the Fancy Bear crew. Again, there was no evidence to suggest the hackers had been successful.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but the concern is these hackers are, uh, still active, building infrastructure. They're definitely looking to sow confusion and disrupt things in the lead-up to these midterms.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but the concern is these hackers are, uh, still active, building infrastructure. They're definitely looking to sow confusion and disrupt things in the lead-up to these midterms.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But they remain active and are building infrastructure that appears to be targeting the midterms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Microsoft's message is pretty clear then: everyone needs to be extra vigilant right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Microsoft's message is pretty clear then: everyone needs to be extra vigilant right now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Especially anyone connected to, like, politics or even businesses with political ties. This isn't going away.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Especially anyone connected to, like, politics or even businesses with political ties. This isn't going away.
